amendatorysection.para: No complete record shall be made (1) in criminal prosecutions where the indictment has been quashed, or where the prosecuting attorney shall have entered a nolle prosequi on the indictment; (2) in cases where the action has been dismissed without prejudice to a future action; (3) in actions in which, in open court, at the term at which the final order or judgment shall be made, both parties shall declare their agreement that no record shall be made.

annotation.para: Complete record in mortgage foreclosure cannot be waived by plaintiff alone even though all defendants default. Colonial & U. S. Mtg. Co. v. Foutch, 31 Neb. 282, 47 N.W. 929 (1891).
